cause.description: SICSA is an oragnization in Kettering, Ohio that is a lot like the humane society. SICSA is a shelter for stray, abandoned, and maltreated animals that are in need of a home. Donations are always appreciated, but the best thing that you could do is to adopt one of the many amazing animals that needs a good home. Featured adoptable pet: FRISKY Breed: Domestic Short Hair-black and white Sex: Female Age: Young Size: Small SICSA IS LOCATED AT: 2600 Wilmington Pike Kettering, Ohio 45419 HOURS: M, TH, F - Noon - 7 pm Sat - 11 am - 4 pm Sun - 1 pm - 4 pm Closed Tuesday & Wednesday 1. Abandoned animals should be rescued and found loving homes. 2. Sick and injured animals should be given a second chance at life. 3. Low cost spay/neuter surgeries are necessary to reduce the number dogs and cats euthanized in Montgomery County.
cause.mission: To promote the welfare of dogs and cats and to nurture the human/animal bond.
cause.name: Support SICSA
